actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to amend title 28 of the United States Code to provide for the appointment of a Special Prosecutor in appropriate cases.

summary.text: Provides for the appointment of a special prosecutor to conduct investigations relative to alleged violations of criminal law involving abuse of office, fraud against the United States, or obstruction of justice, or campaign finance by any of specified Federal officials or campaign managers, including members of Congress who accepted bribes from foreign governments after 1970. Directs the Attorney General to promulgate regulations requiring employees of the Department of Justice to disqualify themselves from investigations or prosecutions which may result in a conflict of interests or the appearance thereof.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 28 of the United States Code to provide for the appointment of a Special Prosecutor in appropriate cases.
